metadata.Title: CVE-2017-17044 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.9.x allowing HVM guest OS users to cause a denial of service (infinite loop and host OS hang) by leveraging the mishandling of Populate on Demand (PoD) errors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-17044` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxencall1 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxendevicemodel1 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxenevtchn1 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxenforeignmemory1 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxengnttab1 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxenmisc4.11 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxenstore3.0 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxentoolcore1 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxentoollog1 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.11-amd64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.11-arm64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.11-armhf - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-common - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-system-amd64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-system-arm64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-system-armhf - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-utils-4.11 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-utils-common - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xenstore-utils - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required
